data.title: Food
data.text:
The steak was fabulous an service was outstanding
Can't wait to visit again
My husband used to come when he worked for Proctor & Gamble.

data.title: Great Steaks Great Service
data.text:
This lil café doesn't open until 5 p.m.  BUT the line starts forming at 4:30-4:45.  A friend recommended us to this place that lives there in Jackson because we had an event to attend at the Civic Center across the way that started at 6p.m.  My new found friend Angie called ahead for us to a waitress..Jenny and gave her a heads up to take care of us.  We were first in line and was they unlocked the door Jenny directed straight to our table with our drinks ready.  My dad and I both order the Ribeye and mom the shrimp.  We walked out of there at 5:45 for $40, bellies full and great great service.  Jenny was the best.  The salad was more than just lettuce and ranch dressing which we appreciated and the steaks were good and juicy.  Mom loved her shrimp as well.  By 5:30 the place was packed and there was a waiting line outside the door.  

We will return next year and if you go there soon tell Jenny the Okies from Oklahoma sent ya.

data.title: Old times dinning.
data.text: Food is fresh and better than the common chain dinners. It's small and needs a fresh coat of paint. The bathroom is very dated, but usable. Love that set at bar, so you can watch your food cook.

data.title: Good food for the price!!
data.text: This little establishment has been in Jackson, TN for many, many years.  It use to be located around the corner (from the location now) on the north side of the old Trailways bus station.  The food is well worth the price, and the atmosphere within the Dixie Castle is always inviting.  Worth the time, and money to eat here.  Enjoy!

data.title: The Locals Love It!!!
data.text: Historic old restaurant in downtown Jackson has served locals for many decades and still has a great rep! All food is very good, but breakfasts and steaks are the best. I had steak cooked medium rare and not only was it perfectly cooked - it was deliciously seasoned. Always full of repeat, local patrons and very popular!

data.title: Good local joint
data.text: Great steaks hamburgers chicken and plate lunches. Not to fancy just good eats and sweet tea. Good stuff here!

data.title: Not my cup of tea
data.text: Smelled of kitchen grease.  Floors felt sticky and slick.  The burger was fine but the smell of hot grease that was all prevailing made it hard to stay there.

data.title: Nothing wrong with a good, greasy burger sometimes
data.text:
Dixie Castle has been around for over 30 years. It is reminiscent of the days when you could sit (and you can) at a lunch counter and grab a quick lunch cooked on the grill in front of you. 
The menu is simple meat and potatoes. It is filling, affordable and fast. 
It's a great place to people watch.

data.title: go0od food
data.text: good food at good price been around for a long time local favorite  steaks at there best been a while since i have been here but the times i have have been very good

data.title: Great polish sausage and cornbread.
data.text: Great plate lunch everyday and great steaks.  Everything is fresh and cooked to order.  Dixie Castle has been doing a great for many many years.  Dixie Castle is a Jackson, TN treasure.

data.title: Lousy service long wait.
data.text: Only went there once waited 20 minutes as the staff definatly catered to working men. What about women? We need to eat quick too. Then got attitude. Don't know if I will ever go back. Maybe not during lunch, for a second try. Better places close by .

data.title: Come down town
data.text: A downtown staple for many years. Food is good not great but prices are very reasonable. This place has been here for a long time because it has a consistent product and does it very well.

data.title: Greasy Spoon Goodness
data.text: A great little greasy spoon-type place.  Great food for reasonable prices.  Can't ask for much more.  Would definitely go back.

data.title: Nothing fancy, just good food
data.text: Small place with limited seating. Usually a line waiting to get in. Great place for family dining. The steaks are very good and always cooked just right! Make sure you save room for dessert, the banana pudding is just like Grandma used to make, and on a busy night they run out early.

data.title: Great steaks
data.text: Never got anything but the best steaks here.  Great food hidden away in downtown Jackson, but close to B. Highland ans,where 45 by pass dumps into downtown. If you want FANCY go somewhere else because this is down home snd just good food. .

data.title: Good steaks
data.text: Steaks are always tasty and tender, sides basic and average.  No frills here!  Just good food at a decent price.

data.title: great food
data.text: Best food for the price anywhere.  Cash only.  Be prepared to enjoy.   If you like steak and homemade French fries, this is the place for you.

data.title: Wonderful steaks
data.text: The Dixie Castle II has some of the best steaks in Jackson. If you are in west Jackson visit on Friday or Saturday evening for good food, great service and excellent price. The banana pudding is good also

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Burgers are great about $5 for a combo...fast service pretty nice scenery around  at lunch time!  I like the downtown  location best

data.title: Can't go wrong
data.text: Locally owned, 2 locations.  Excellent service. We have eaten at Dixie Castle for several years . ( Affectionantey referred to as DC). 2 reasons we eat steak at DC only....  i tend to judge my restaurants by their sweet tea......excellent here!  They make their own blue cheese dressing, delicious!  I've  had one bad steak in about 10 years,  I ordered it well instead of med well..otherwise no issues.  #2. It's hometown service, no loud music, no waiting in a cattle pen with a beeper. AND  it is family friendly, no alcohol , if a patron wants to say the blessing ,they are not interrupted by someone yelling at the bar.
